intro: Turritis hirtella, commonly known as the hairy turritis, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces showy, tubular flowers that are typically purple or violet in color. It thrives in rocky soils and arid environments, often found in desert scrub and chaparral habitats. Turritis hirtella is a perennial shrub that is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures.
